p: On February 11, 2020, the Coronaviridae Study Group of the International Committee on Taxonomy of Viruses (ICTV-CSG) announced that the novel coronavirus (2019-nCoV) had been officially classified as severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2). The World Health Organization (WHO) declared that the novel coronavirus infection was named coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) [ 1]. By March 11, 2020, more than 118,000 confirmed cases (including 4291 deaths in 114 geographical territories) had been reported, and the WHO made the assessment that the COVID-19 outbreak can be characterized as a pandemic.
